title: FERMA
subTitle: Federal Road Mentainance Agency (Nigeria)
alterText: Ferma is a road maintenance platform that uses SMEs technologies and USSD to report bad federal roads in Nigeria. With just a simple *123*345#  You can select the current local govt where the road is then report that bad road, during the process, you will also receive a prompt asking if you would like to upload an image of the bad road thus sending a one-time link. Project has an analytics dashboard where the data are correlated into smart graphs and metrics for decision making

journey.title: Background
journey.description: Smart sahara's objective was primarily focused on discoveries, research, problem solving then presentation, at the time, My employer; Mr Emmanuel proposed that we solved the problem with bad governments road in Nigeria, due to the countless federal road cutting across state lines, it was perceived that the agency incharge of road maintenance FERMA which stands for Federal Road Maintenance Agency might not be informed to these issues thus the need to create a real time report / response system became a clear path to a solution. After weeks of deliberation, what approach, tools and how to go about the project became vivid thus the concept

journey.title: Concept
journey.description: Due to the not so good internet connection along inter-states travel-lines across federal roads in the country, a problem it seemed because if we were to make this work ?! We needed to communicate to the datastore with very minimal connectivity, USSD became a great choice. The concept was to allow users dial a USSD code when they spot a bad road, then creating a good experience that helps them alternate through the process of reporting these data and processing them on the admin panel had to be seamless. We also created a prompt option where users can then choose if they would like to follow up their reports with an image, if they choose to ?! an SMS is then sent to their phone number containing a one-time link where they could take a picture or pictures of the bad road thus completing their report. The agent on the other hand could view reports, users who reported bad roads with analytical data depiction that coordinate better decision making to improve response time to these issues.

journey.title: Challenges
journey.description: Although this project was vigirously and carefully thought through, the presentation stage took a while, we had contacted the federal govt in regards to the solution and thus met with the CEO, Mr Emmanuel Ogolekwu countless times. Then afterwards, handing over of the project and documenation due to onboarding processes took a while. It was my first time being in a situation where I had to handover a system to the federal govt, it was fun and a great experience but a challenging one nonetheless.

reviews.name: Emmanuel Ogolekwu
reviews.comment: Ahmed has worked on countless projects under smartsahara and the most important thing to point out is his reliability to finish on time and also meet up to the agreed upon expectations.

title: Anointing Global App
subTitle: Private Church Application
alterText: Anointing Global Church is one of the biggest churches in Nigeria with over 300,00+ members from different ethincity and languages across Nigeria. The church HQ is located at Lagos, Nigeria, one of the biggest hotspot in sub-saharan West Africa and thus, also having members outside Nigeria who tune into the live stream. Until before the app, most of the church online activities with the objective of reaching out to a wider audience were carried out using social media platforms such as facebook and youTube, exploiting the live streaming features of these social space. The anointing global app solves countless pre-existing problems with the church prior approach to communicating with their target audience such as disseminating crucial and time sensitive information. The app allows user register for free, access church meterials and media assets, church store infuse with a marketplace settings, live stream and many more.

journey.title: Background
journey.description: It was December of 2020, I was with family becase I had travelled back home for an event; my dad's younger brother was getting married and I was thrilled to go back home due to the nature of that year, I hadn't experienced such an unprecedented year due to... you know, it whose name must not be spoken had happened and the entire world was in distress. I was glad to be ending that year with loved ones around and what better celebration to end the year than the union of two people bringing everyone together. I got a call from someone I had worked with on a different project months ago asking if I'd be interested in working on a different project relating to matter of religious importance come January of the next year, A church app he said, as a muslim; I was very much interested to work with someone who preached a different faith from what I practiced. Although people often Nigeria is it odds in religious practices, that's farther from the truth; We had discussed briefly over the phone about the paradigm of the project and a possible timeframe to hitting every milestone. Afterward, an oral agreement to discussing further when I had return from the holidays.

journey.title: Concept & Approach
journey.description:
Few days into the New Year, 2021 seemed promising as most people seemed to have adapted to the new way of life and thus created a path of success around these circumstances. A follow up call about the later discussion, the church app came in on the 5th of January 2021; this time, technically driven and astute to requirements and deliverables. Documents exhanged, the concept, A platform to replace using facebook and youTube as a primary tool for live streaming. Since Flutter was to be used, I dived into action, research on live streaming tools, performance data amongst viable choices, reliabilty and community where the main 3 factors I considered. Reasons,

Performance: Live streaming requires a library with a compression algorithm that's lossless, thus increasing the buffered frame interchange and retain quality of the video. if the goal was to have a very similar experience in comparison to using YouTube and Facebook, two tech giant with limitless resources, I had to go with a reasonable performance metrics.

Reliability: Using third party API can be a blessing and a blessing and a curse as most open source libraries are legacy libraries and some are forever changing, meaning, modules become depreciated or improved and at times become quite unstable. This is one big developer's dilemma, as it increases the urgency to always check for broken or obsolete code functions. since this isn't an unforseen issue, looking for libraries with stability and a smart means of notifying developers when changes are implemented in their libabries is something to look out for.

Comminity: "Alone we can do so little; together, we can do so much" â€“ Helen Keller; A developer is only as strong as the community they belong to, that's the power of open source because a lot of libraries are developed by incredible developers around the world in the hope of whatever block of code contributed helps out another. When selecting a library, it's important to know how big of a comminity is associated to that library as it becomes easier to debug issues attributed to that library.

reviews.name: Makinde Tunji
reviews.comment: Ahmed has an incredible eye for translating designs to an acute similarity of the approved UI, that he is a great person to work with is an understatement, always ready to improvise to accomodate others when there are set backs.

title: Luxury Citizenship
subTitle: Resort & Travel Agency
alterText: Luxury Citizenship provides a turn-key solution to legal second citizenship Whether you are an individual or applying with your family to the various countries they support, They offer trustworthy guidance at every step, ensuring complete peace of mind and a streamlined application process that complies with government regulations. These conducts with Due Diligence checks on all potential clients using the World-Check system, comply with a robust system of AML/CFT/ KYC policies and procedures and store and transmit all client information using secure servers.

journey.title: Background
journey.description: I received a notification on Upwork about a short contract job which piqued my interest as I went on to placing a bid for the opportuinity, I eventually got a response after 5 days from someone by the name David, he wanted to meet over on zoom to discuss the opportuinity, after a 30 min discussion, I noticed he wasn't assure then I offered to start the work but uploading it on a temporary linked where he could have access to my progress, and if he was comfortable with my work ethics, I would take charge of the entire work, it worked as I was able to put his mind to rest and thus commencing on the work. He explained what he was into, and wanted a platform where he could easily engage with his target audiences and a means they could use to reach out to him. It was a very simple project but one very detailed on UI design.

journey.title: Concept
journey.description: I told him to make a rough sketch so I could get a UI/UX person involved to design something cut to his specification which he did. As soon as we were done with the design journey, I realized it wasn't as simple as I had imagined. So I told him I was going to design a landing page to see if he liked the live version of it. I had gotten back to him after a week and he was impressed and agreed to hand over the entire project to me. The concept was for the site to have all the information his client would require to understanding how his processes worked and a blog page where he could write articles and most importantly, a contact us form where his clients could reach out to him if they were interested to had any questions to ask.

journey.title: Challenges
journey.description: Having to agree on a single design approach was a little bit fuzzy, I had to pay close attention to what he wanted and concluded in making improvisions if he liked it, if he didn't ?! I would remove; until I brought in a UI/UX person which was better able to translate his design approach. It was a bitter sweet experience but a great one nonetheless.

reviews.name: David Matthew
reviews.comment: I met Ahmed on upwork and although his resume seemed impressive, I was a bit skeptical. I gave him the project in good faith and he didn't dissapoint me; he is a smart and incredible at what he does.

title: Albert's Vendor
subTitle: PWA Coupon Platform
alterText: AlbertsVendor is a 3rd party online vendor that sells racksterli coupons for users across Nigeria, Racksterli is an online digital trading platform or a compact brookers platform that trades assets for people through the means of forex under an agreed percentage income. These incomes are agreed upon based on the category of the coupons bought, due to the high traffic of this coupons, 3rd party vendors becomes a means to speed up sales; Albertsvendor is one of 20 other vendors who sells their coupons manually, in retrospect, AlbertVendor is the first digital platform for these sales thus selling out coupons within minute even when they're not available.

journey.title: Background
journey.description: I got a call from a friend of mine who was studying an Msc in Cyber Security in the United Kingdom, he had a side business, one he used as a secondary income; A coupon marchant he said and he's been getting so much traffic that he's also been losing sales due to the time lapses between his studies and when his customers needed his attention. Due to the manual nature of his business approach, it wasn't working out and thus, he knew he needed to take a dire action because he was heading towards a consequential business failure. He spoke to me about his business processes and asked if there was a way to automate the sales of these coupons even when he wasn't remote available to personally attend to his customers; I gave an answer any developer would've. Yes, Yes I have just the right solution I said.

journey.title: Concept
journey.description: The priority, to improve the sales of the already huge traffic he has been gainning as a vendor. The concept, was to create a platform where he could upload all coupons in categories into the system, implement a payment gateway that help process the payment transactions and a way to deliver this coupons automatically via email or phone number. We had done a test run of the product after completion, then we realized we needed to engage user, thus creating accounts and sessions where could track all the coupons bought and also placing more order without having to reissue their personal credentials. We concluded we need to create a account approach where users could register, sign in, place orders and track coupons effectively thus increasing the sales for my client and improving the user experience for the entire process leading to outpour of praises from his target audiences and his competitors.

reviews.name: Oloruntola Timileyin
reviews.comment: Ahmed's has a very quick response time to situations, the performance of the website was fast and kept up to the deadline. Even after completing the project, he kept intouch to know if the site had any issues or if there were anything needed of him to do. Great guy.

title: PayWithSellfast
subTitle: Digital Marketting Payment Portal
alterText: PayWithSellfast is a digital marketting web application that manages and shows illustrated data in forms of charts and tables of users daily engagements, activities and subscription status and also processes fees using flutterwave payment gateway. This product was a sub-strategic realease in relation to sellfast, which is an online marketplace in Nigeria, during the covid 19 pendemic, The instagram page was used to promote people's good on a price plan, thus needing a marketting tool to track users with active subscriptions in order to manage the large numbers of audiences they had acquired at that time

journey.title: Background
journey.description: After a couple of projects down, we had ran some ads campaign for some of the incredible products we had developed, we came across some ads marketting agency and their prices were a bit too expensive. Due to the nature of the year, a lot of people struggled financially due to the lockdown as some companies had to let their employees ago. It became the perfect opportunity and an idea for a product, the goal; run ads campaign for business owners at a very affordable rate. Within a week of launching this new campaign, we gained over 10,000 followers on instagram and a lot of business owners started sending in DM's wanting us to run ads for them on our sellfast social media handles, this test run had proven to be effective, even with about 5 to 6 sales representative on ground, it became too much to handle. Now we needed to build a platform that manages the process effectively in tracking down users requests.

journey.title: Concept
journey.description: The goal was to organize, manage users activities and subscription in order to better synchronize with the live campaign going on. The Digital Marketting Tool PayWithSellfast was a way to keep tabs on which user had an active running campaign, the traffic growth and analytics to show the income insight real time and within a spaced out period of time. A payment gateway by flutterwave was used for transactional activities within sellfast and the user, then aftwards their informations including their social media handles are capture and their subscription starts; At this point, both parties are alerted via SMS and their campaigns becomes live were could see and interact with their target audience, this also made it easier for the sales team to effectively know when the subscription ends and they're alerted as the processes are automated.

reviews.name: Emmanuel Egolegwu
reviews.comment: Ahmed has worked on countless projects under smartsahara and the most important thing to point out is his reliability to finish on time and also meet up to the agreed upon expectations.

title: Kidaccess
subTitle: Digital e-Learning App
alterText:
Kidaccess is an e-learning application for students using the Nigerian education system from Nursery 1 to Primary 6. 
 This solution, provides a standard prescribed learning courses based on the student classes, a time table, a learning scheme and weekly assements challenges for each of their preferred subjects. In this app, a student can self register or be invited by their designated teacher to onboard the app, afterwards, they are assigned to a specific learning class which could include subjects like, quantitative, verbal reasoning, english, maths etc... Once this is done, they can now unlock weekly assesments set by their designated teachers. 
 This is an instant learning application, which means once they answer the questions. Their total score is shown to them for the week and this gets populated to the assesments records for further academic cummulation.

journey.title: Background
journey.description: Unlike what I had develop in the past, a school management system was a bit far from normal, I had hoped to develop one during my journey as a software engineer but I hadn't been confronted with one just yet. When I had finally gotten a gig request from an NGO in the United Kingdom, the search I presume was for the contract role for a Fullstack Developer, one would argue that the word 'Fullstack' seem benial and far from reality but I thought to myself. If I am to pull this off, I might as well be qualified to refer to myself as one. After meeting with the clients, or potential client as one might prefer; since at that point, I hadn't been officially hired for the position. they eventually disclosed the project concept and won't you guess what it was?! Yes, you guessed right. A School Management System, I was more than interested, the experience for me was all that mattered, another dragon to slay and I was also akeen to the project requirements because like what we already established in my biography, I like to give 110%

journey.title: Concept
journey.description: I was enventually trusted with the oversight and development of the product, they had discussed carefully what they wanted. Although, I am very aware that sometimes, clients aren't always technically savvy thus might end up shooting themselves in the legs, whilst some might know exactly what they want ?! I always offer technical consultation about their products thus giving them a clear path to visualizing what the deliverables are. In this particular project. They wanted something quite different from the generic School Management System. Since it was an NGO, their objectives for this project was to partner with schools in giving out free digital tabs to students where Kidaccess would be pre-installed. Then onboard techers under their already partnered instituion. In this whole paradigm, with an urgency to understand the models, relationships and responsibility these actors had indifferent to one another, I made alot of research and created use cases. The product concept was more like a business to business solution, even though it didn't seem so at first ?! Meeting up to every deliverables projected a much more opportuinistic product with countless problem solving realm to explore.

journey.title: Challenges
journey.description:
There was one distinctive challenge faced during this particular product journey,
Too Many Shifting Dynamics: I know this sounds like something out of Seth Macfarlane's series, The Orville but hear me out. It's common for there to be changes in client's objective during the development phase, one could even argue that every software engineer anticipate this especially when you're a freelancer thus working with someone at an idea stage. Yes, I did anticipate shifting dynamics but it became quite a difficulty for me when it became too frequent. Newer upgrades outside the agreed deliverables became so much. Like I said, the product was quite broad that it opened room for a lot of opportuinities and exploits, my client wanted to explore all these exploits during the development which eventually delayed the agreed upon deadline for the product.

reviews.name: Ezeh A.C Payne
reviews.comment: Having been in the tech sector for a decade,  excellent work ethics has been a bane working or outsourcing part of our jobs; pressed on delivering a project; we brought Ahmed on board and he has been nothing short of amazing. His attention to details and excellent delivery on ux interface of the project was as we envisage. Great working with him

reviews.name: Makinde Tunji
reviews.comment: Ahmed has an incredible eye for translating designs to an acute similarity of the approved UI, that he is a great person to work with is an understatement, always ready to improvise to accomodate others when there are set backs.
